flavor: "Granny Orne? Why are you in space?"
name: Anachronism
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, either discard a non-story asset you control, or take 1 horror.

name: Haunting Past
text: Peril. Revelation - Test [willpower] (X). X is your "Memories." If you fail, search the encounter deck for the topmost hidden card and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Reminiscence (Pledge)
text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. [reaction] When an investigator would defeat an enemy at your location, heal all damage from it instead: Discard this card. Forced - When the game ends, or if you are eliminated, if this card is in your hand: Add it to the victory display.

name: Reminiscence (Secrets)
text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. [reaction] When an investigator would discover any amount of clues from your location, place 1 of their clues on that location instead of discovering clues: Discard this card. Forced - When the game ends, or if you are eliminated, if this card is in your hand: Add it to the victory display.

name: Reminiscence (Covenant)
text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. [reaction] When an investigator would successfully evade an enemy at your location, that enemy immediately attacks them instead: Discard this card. Forced - When the game ends, or if you are eliminated, if this card is in your hand: Add it to the victory display.

name: The Feaster from Afar
text: Massive. Revelation - Spawn the Feaster from Afar at your location. Forced - After The Feaster from Afar attacks you: Heal all damage from it and place it at the bottom of the scanning deck.

name: Call of the Void
text: Surge. Cannot be cancelled or ignored. Revelation - If there are 3 or more tally marks under "Impending Doom" in your Campaign Log, shuffle the set aside The Feaster from Afar enemy into the scanning deck. Then, remove from the game.

flavor: Horror vacui -- nature abhors a vacuum.
name: Cold Vacuum
text: Revelation - Test [combat] (3). If you fail, you must either (choose one): Discard a non-story asset you control, or choose and discard 3 cards from your hand.

name: Micrometeoroid
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, you must either (choose one): Take 2 damage, or discard each event in your hand.

name: The Colors of Space
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, put this card into play in your threat area. You must commit all eligible skill cards in your hand to skill tests performed at your location. Take 1 horror: Discard .

name: Grim Future
text: Peril. Revelation - Add Grim Future to any investigator's threat area. Forced - When the act or agenda advances: Take 1 damage and 1 horror. Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard .

name: Future Evils
text: Revelation - Put into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After a scenario card places any amount of doom on a card: Place 1 additional doom and discard . This effect may cause the current agenda to advance.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[AI]] encounter cards in play.
[cultist]: -3. If you fail, place 1 of your clues onto your current location.
name: The Tatterdemalion
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[AI]] encounter cards in your threat area.
[cultist]: -2. If you fail, place 1 of your clues onto your current location.

back_flavor: The reactor melts down and detonates, annihilating the Tatterdemalion. In your last moments, you see a bright yellow crown reigning in the vastness of space.
back_text: Each investigator is killed. Ths investigators lose the campaign. There is no resolution.
flavor:
As you try to make sense of the situation, an alarm blares through the chamber and interrupts your thoughts.
<center>ALERT.</center>
<center>ENGINE STABILITY AT 7%.</center>
<center>SYSTEM POWER CRITICAL</center>
<center>REQUIRES IMMEDIATE ATTENTION.</center>
name: Emergency Procedure
text: You cannot resign. (Beware - If this agenda advances, the ship will explode and everyone will die.)

flavor: The computerized voices sob and sing snippets of nursery rhymes. The ship's lights flicker along and the automated hatches snap open and closed. The Tatterdemalion has a mind of its own.
name: The Ghost Ship
text: [action] If there are no clues on your current location: Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with an icon matching your current location and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

flavor: "TARGET ACQUIRED"
name: UPL-A21 ‘Demhe’
text: Spawn - Cargo Hold. Hunter. While moving or engaging, UPL-A21 ‘Demhe’ ignores investigators without an [[AI]] encounter card in their threat area.

back_flavor: Without warning, all of the lights in your room shut off. A loud mechanical thud and a sharp pain in the back of your head are the last things you remember before you plummet to the floor, into unconsciousness.
back_text: Each remaining undefeated investigator is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.
flavor: The ship's AI is reaching out to every machine, to manipulate, to control. Hopelessly lost in its own insanity, it will stop at nothing to exterminate the intruders that are invading its home.
name: Rise of the Machines
text: [action] If there are no clues on your current location: Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with an icon matching your current location and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

back_flavor:
As the nuclear-ion engines begin their reboot sequence, the emergency lights shut off and leave you in darkness.
You see glimpses of an image—of a memory. A great golden palace stands before you, older than time itself. A throne befit for a Queen, reigning over the infinite void of a sunless space.
When the main fluorescent lights return, an ear piercing scream resonates out of the intercom system. It is the sound of several children's roboticized voices crying out in unison. "Intruders detected! Go away! Please, leave us alone!"
back_text: Shuffle the set aside Artificial Intelligence encounter set into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. This set is indicated by the following icon: [encounter=artificial_intelligence] Advance to agenda 2a and act 2a. Do not remove doom from play and transfer all doom from agenda 1a to agenda 2a.
flavor: Your body aches and cramps from the extended cryosleep. How long have you been trapped in your frozen tomb? Where is the rest of the crew? These questions will need to wait, for you must first find a way to get this ship back online before the reactor engines overheat.
name: Event Horizon
text: Objective - Investigators in the Engine Room may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to repair the power malfunction and advance.

back_flavor:
It would be impossible to physically bypass or rewire K2-PS187. However, there is another way to repair the 'computer'. If you can reprogram the cryosleep chamber's dream protocols to interface with K2-PS187, you will essentially create a pocket reality in which you can virtually interact with K2-PS187 within its dreams. From there, you'll be able to bring the poor minds back to their senses.
However, without proper psychological conditioning, entering the virtual reality may be damaging to your identity—leaving you in a state of decoherence. Although some of your procedural memories have returned, your self-identity is still out of tune. You may want to explore the ship and remember who you used to be.
back_text: Put the set aside Virtual Access Key story asset into play under any investigator's control. That investigator may choose to add it to their deck. This card does not count toward that investigator's deck limit.
flavor: Restoring power to the Tatterdemalion's systems activated a new problem—the ship's malfunctioning AI is now operational, and trying to terminate you. You must find a way to fix it or shut it down before it expels you from the ship.
name: Artificial Insanity
text: Objective - Figure out how to repair or disable the insane cybernetic AI. (You will be instructed when to advance.).

back_flavor: By connecting to the ship's mainframe, you adapte the cryo-chambers to import your soon-to-be dreaming self into K2-PS187's shared dreams. You lay down into your coffin once more and activate the machine's sleep sequence…
back_name: Through the Gates of the Virtual Dreamlands
flavor: You must find a way to reprogram the cryosleep chambers to access K2-PS187's virtual dreamscape and calm it down.
name: Reconnected
text:
Objective - After an investigator at the Cryosleep Quarters performs a scan matching the icon below, regardless of whether it is successful or not, you may advance.
[location=green_clover]
(Beware—remember to collect as many memories as you can)

flavor:
"Inside, wrapped in a discoloured parchment, was a huge key of tarnished silver covered with cryptical arabesques; but of any legible explanation there was none."
- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Silver Key"
name: Virtual Access Key
subname: Key to the Gate of Dream
text: [reaction] When you would take horror, exhaust Virtual Access Key: Cancel 1 of that horror.

back_text: The pressure door leading to the back of the ship needs to be rewired. As an additional cost to enter the <fullname>, investigators in the Mess Hall must spend 1[per_investigator] clues, as a group.
name: Cargo Hold
flavor: As you step through the door, you see dozens of corpses, mutilated and mangled. Scrawled on the floor, in blood and gore, are the words "no hope".
text: Forced - After you enter the : Test [willpower] (2). If you fail, take 1 horror.

back_flavor: Human interstellar space travel was only possible due to the invention of cryo-chambers, capable of suspending the body’s autonomic functions while maintaining the health of each individual cell during stasis.
name: Cryosleep Quarters
flavor: The room looks like a funeral parlor with six human-sized boxes lined up along the walls. Cold lights shine down from the ceiling, illuminating every corner.
text: : Resign. Return to your cryo-chamber and hope you wake up from this nightmare.

back_flavor: Although nuclear-ion engines allow for relatively safe intrasolar travel and can power all nominal functions of a Kepler-class starship, this type of generator is prone to overheating.
name: Engine Room
flavor: The huge room hums. The vibrations under your feet are so thick, they reach straight through the soles of your shoes. Everything looks and feels too hot.
text: Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are at the and do not control Radiation Tablets: Take 1 damage.

back_flavor: Escape pods are an essential asset of any starship. Even though the chances of finding a pod drifting through endless space is infinitely minuscule, it offers travellers peace of mind -- and hope.
name: Escape Pod Bay
flavor: Slammed together, like compacted teeth, are the three empty coffins. Further inspection reveals that the escape pods have all been sabotaged.
text: [reaction] After you succeed at evading an enemy at this location: Defeat that enemy. (Group limit 3 times per game.)

back_flavor: A common ship infirmary by Colonial standards is well stocked with medical supplies of all kinds.
name: Infirmary
text: : Scan. Look for medical supplies. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with the icon below and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

back_flavor: The mess hall is the center of the ship -- both physically and spiritually. Without social bonding, the isolation of space would take its toll on anyone.
name: Mess Hall
flavor: No signs of human activity. There is enough food to feed the entire waking crew for months -- even years.
text: [reaction] When you gain any amount of resources during your turn at the <fullname>: Gain 1 additional resource. (Limit once per round.)

back_text: Investigators cannot enter the Ship's Bridge from the Mess Hall. Your access level is restricted. You will need to find another way inside.
name: Ship's Bridge
flavor: There is a whole bank of instruments and controls. It will take some time to decipher how to read them.
text: Forced - After you perform a scan at this location, if there are no clues on it: Add 1[per_investigator] clues on it from the token bank.

flavor: Highly virulent, techno-organic viruses are often used by computers as natural defense mechanisms against virtual invaders.
name: Cybervirus
text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced -- After you discover the last clue from a location: Spawn Cybervirus engaged with you.

name: EVA Suit
text: Revelation - You may put into play under the control of any investigator. If you are at an Access location: Move to another Access location. Then, Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with the icon below and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

flavor:
You search the Tatterdemalion's console and discover its itinerary. Over a year ago, the ship departed in search of a trans-Saturnian asteroid of extrasolar origin codenamed "Fragment". The crew eventually found the mysterious object and sent several survey and excavation teams for unknown purposes. The mission proceeded smoothly, until the Tatterdemalion suddenly lost contact with one of its survey teams deep within the subterranean caverns of Fragment.
Despite the disappearance, the mission was apparently deemed a success, and the ship was set to return home.
You vaguely recall stepping out of a shuttle, onto the rocky surface of a golden asteroid. The stars glittered bright and red. You must have been on one of the Tatterdemalion's survey teams.
name: Final Destination
text:
Each investigator at your location adds 1 tally mark next to their "Memories".
You may gain up to 3 resources.
Add this card to the victory display.

name: Heir to Carcosa
text: Revelation - Add Heir to Carcosa to your deck. Permanent. [reaction] When earning experience during the resolution of a scenario: The investigator with the least mental trauma (choose one if there are more than one) earns 1 additional experience for each mental trauma that investigator has.

flavor:
Within the digital environment of the ship, you come across a vault containing petabytes of encrypted data. It appears that the Tatterdemalion's archives contain the brain scans and histories of hundreds of people from the 20th and 21st century. Curious, you search for your own name and are surprised to find files corresponding to your past life.
According to these records, you were institutionalized after attempting to sabotage a theatre play. You lived the rest of your life in isolation, warning to all of "Carcosa" and of the one named "Hastur". After your death, your brain was preserved by the institution and eventually scanned for scientific research.
Despite feeling sorrow for your past life, you can finally let go of that reality. Even though it's not exactly the world you expected, you've been given a second chance at life, and aim to not repeat the same mistakes.
name: Into the Archives
text:
Each investigator at your location adds 1 tally mark next to their "Memories".
You may heal up to 2 horror.
Add this card to the victory display.

name: JV-7 'Hyades'
text: Aloof. Alert. : Parley. Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, attacks you. If you succeed, choose one of the icons below. Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with the chosen icon and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

flavor:
You finally uncover the direct access point to interface with the Tatterdemalion's main computer, K2-PS187. However, you quickly realize that disabling or rewiring it will not be as simple as you anticipated.
K2-PS187 is not a true computer at all, and is actually a cybernetic organism. Deep within the mechanics of the ship’s bridge is the computer core, and within it are the disembodied brains of six young children. These brains are linked together to form a very powerful super-computer.
The situation sickens you to the core. Who would do such a thing? Damning these minds to an eternity of calculating ship trajectories and processing algorithms. You feel guilty, knowing that you must have been part of this heinous crew.
name: K2-PS187 Cybernetic Brains
text:
Each investigator adds 1 tally mark next to their "Memories", regardless of their location.
Advance to act 2b.
Add this card to the victory display.

name: LR-02 'Hali'
text: Aloof. Retaliate. Forced - After you defeat this enemy: Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with the icon below and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

name: Medical Foam
text: Revelation - You may put this card into play under the control of any investigator. Uses (3 supplies). [reaction] After an investigator at your location takes any amount of damage, exhaust Medical Foam and spend 1 supply: Heal that amount of damage from them.

name: Mind-Machine Interface
text: Revelation - You may put this card into play under the control of any investigator. Spend 2[per_investigator] clues, as a group: Scan. Search for the topmost card in the scanning deck with the icon below and draw it. Shuffle the scanning deck.

name: Radiation Tablets
text: Revelation - You may put this card into play under the control of any investigator. Uses (3 supplies). Spend 1 supply: You get +1 [combat] and +1 [agility] until the end of the round.

flavor:
Donning the EVA suit, you leave the pressurized atmosphere of the ship to climb across the outside of the vessel. The Tatterdemalion appears much larger from the outside -- you barely see the access point on the other side. It will take quite some time to traverse the ship.
As you glide forwards, a glint from above catches your eye. A yellow and green flare undulates in the canvas of space. It dances in the sky and entwines into a singular design -- rings of concentric semicircles lined with strange runes, and at the center is a pair of wavy lines. You have seen this symbol before -- during the presentation of The King in Yellow. However, this wasn't the one in the Ward Theatre, but an amateur performance in the cramped and industrial interior of the Tatterdemalion.
After the strange lights fade away, you realize you completely let go of your tethers and were beginning to drift away. With a small thrust of your suit's reaction control system, you grab hold of the ship once more and hastily climb your way to the next airlock, with a much firmer grip.
name: Strange is the Night
text:
Add 2 tally marks next to your "Memories".
Add this card to the victory display.

name: Ventilation Shaft
flavor: An endless maze of cramped and dirty tunnels.
text: Revelation - Put this location into play. Forced - When you would enter : Test [agility] (3). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move.

flavor:
Near the stern of the vessel is a large structure of human bones and skulls. At the top of the creation is a wax sculpture of a female figure in a yellow dress. The sculpture itself must be at least a hundred years old. It all seems so surreal, and sad.
In front of the strange altar lies a scroll which holds the first draft of a new prayer being written to a “Tassilda, Royal Princess of Carcosa.” You are certain you have heard this name before, but you can't recall when.
name: What Type of Ship is This?
text:
Each investigator at your location adds 1 tally mark next to their "Memories".
You must either (choose one):
- Place 1 doom on the current agenda and add this card to the victory display. This effect may cause the current agenda to advance.
- Remove this card from the game.

flavor:
Now that the ship's power has been restored and the imminent threat eliminated, you can re-examine the protocols of the cryo-chamber in which you were hibernating. The database mentions names and dates you have never heard of before, but that you instinctively know refer to you and your true history. According to the control panel, you were a citizen of the United Colonial Coalition, and you were born in 2127, in a city named New Brooklyn.
Further details suggest that the ship's AI has been implanting and running a simulation with the bodies of several of the sleeping crew. You probe for more information, but the main network catches on and shuts down the display before you can continue.
name: Who am I?
text:
Each investigator at your location adds 1 tally mark next to their "Memories".
You may search the top 6 cards of your deck for a card and draw it.
    Add this card to the victory display.

name: Artificial Gravity Malfunction
text: Revelation - Attach this card to your current location. While you are at attached location, each move action and ability costs 1 additional action. [reaction] At the end of the round, if you are at attached location: Discard Artificial Gravity Malfunction.

name: Cabin Pressure
text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - At the end of your turn, if there are 1 or more clues on your location: Take 2 damage and discard . : Discard Cabin Pressure.

flavor: Without coolant, heat generating structures in a vacuum would get really hot, really fast.
name: Coolant Leak
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). For each point you fail by, either choose and discard a card from your hand, or take 1 damage. If you control the EVA Suit story asset, you automatically succeed.

flavor: "Splat."
name: Decompression
text: Revelation - Attach to the nearest Access location. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at attached location without the EVA Suit story asset takes 3 direct damage. Discard .

flavor: The biggest source of ionizing radiation is from solar particle events, the repercussions of having a Sun.
name: High Radiation Levels
text: Revelation - Test [agility] or [combat] (3). If you fail, deal 1 direct damage to your investigator and to each Ally asset you control. If you control Radiation Tablets, you automatically succeed at this test.

name: All-Seeing Eye
text: Revelation - Put this card into play in your threat area. As an additional cost to perform a scan, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an AI encounter card is discarded and draw it. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard All-Seeing Eye.

flavor: Arcs of electricity erupt from the nearest machinery towards you.
name: Electric Surge
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (2). This test gains +1 difficulty for each AI encounter card in your threat area. If you fail, each investigator at your location takes 1 damage, and gains surge.

name: Hallucinatory Holograms
text: Hidden. Peril. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - At the end of your turn, if there is at least 1 AI encounter card in your threat area: Take 2 horror and discard . : Discard .

name: Predictive Algorithm
text: Revelation - Put into play in your threat area. You get -1 to each of your skills while fighting or evading AI enemies. Choose and discard 2 cards from your hand: Discard .

flavor: The ATL-4 model spider bots can sneak into the crevices of machines to repair malfunctions from within.
name: System Bug
text: Nearest location with no clues. Forced - After enters play: Place 1 clue on its location (from the token bank).

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is your “Memories”.
[cultist]: -3. If you fail and you have a hidden card in your hand, take 1 horror.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. Double that token’s modifier.
name: Electric Nightmare
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half your “Memories” (rounded down).
[cultist]: -2. If you fail and you have a hidden card in your hand, take 1 horror.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. Double that token’s modifier.

name: Desync
text: Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Suffer 1 mental trauma and add 1 tally mark next to your "Memories". Then, exile this card. - If your deck has 5 or more cards in it, shuffle this card back into your deck. Otherwise, discard it.

name: K2-PS187
text: Permanent. [reaction] At the start of the round, choose an investigator: That investigator gets an additional action during their turn, which may only be used to activate Scan abilities.

name: K2-PS187
text: Permanent. [fast] During the investigation phase, choose an investigator: That investigator gets an additional action during their turn, which may only be used to activate Scan abilities. (Limit once per round.)

name: K2-PS187
text: Permanent. [fast] During the investigation phase, choose an investigator: That investigator gets an additional action during their turn, which may only be used to activate Scan abilities. (Limit once per round.) [reaction] After an investigator performs an unsuccessful scan: That investigator may draw 1 card or gain 1 resource.

name: K2-PS187
text: Permanent. [fast] During the investigation phase, choose an investigator: That investigator gets an additional action during their turn, which may only be used to activate Scan abilities. (Limit once per round.) [reaction] After an investigator performs a scan: That investigator may draw 1 card or gain 1 resource. (Limit once per round.)

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the number of face-down encounter cards in your threat area.
[cultist]: -X. X is the number of locations in play.
[tablet]: -2. Reveal another token. If you fail, put the top card of the encounter deck into your threat area, face down.
[elder_thing]: -4. Randomly draw a face-down encounter card in your threat area.
name: Lost Quantum
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of face-down encounter cards in your threat area.
[cultist]: -X. X is half the number of locations in play (rounded down).
[tablet]: -1. Reveal another token. If you fail, put the top card of the encounter deck into your threat area, face down.
[elder_thing]: -3. Randomly draw a face-down encounter card in your threat area.

name: Erwin Simmons
text: [reaction] When your turn begins, put the top card of the encounter deck face-down into your threat area: Fight/Evade/Investigate. If you fail, deal 1 damage to Erwin Simmons. Forced - - When Erwin Simmons leaves play: Draw all face-down encounter cards in your threat area.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is half the amount of damage on you and assets you control (rounded up).
[cultist]: -3. If you fail, deal 1 damage or 1 horror to an [[Ally]] asset you control.
[tablet]: -1. Reveal another token. If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: 0. You must either (choose one): Take 3 damage, or this test automatically fails.
name: In the Shadow of Earth
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the amount of damage on you and assets you control (rounded down).
[cultist]: -2. If you fail, deal 1 damage or 1 horror to an [[Ally]] asset you control.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: 0. You must either (choose one): Take 2 damage, or this test automatically fails.

name: Space Artillery
text:
Uses (2 supplies).
[action][action] Choose a location and spend 1 supply: Deal 3 damage to each enemy and investigator at that location and at each connecting location.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -3. If you fail, deal 1 damage to the nearest [[Brain]] story asset.
[cultist]: -3. If you revealed another chaos token during this test, take 1 horror.
[tablet]: Reveal 2 additional tokens for this test.
[elder_thing]: -4. If this is an attack or evasion attempt against a [[Byakhee]] enemy, reveal an additional token for this test.
name: Strange Moons
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -2. If you fail, deal 1 damage a [[Brain]] story asset.
[cultist]: -2. If you revealed another chaos token during this test, take 1 horror.
[tablet]: Reveal 2 additional tokens for this test.
[elder_thing]: -3. If this is an attack or evasion attempt against a [[Byakhee]] enemy, reveal an additional token for this test.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is your “Memories.”
[cultist]: -X. X is the number of hidden cards in your hand.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. Double that token’s modifier.
[elder_thing]: -6. You may choose to cross out a tally mark next to your investigator’s “Memories” to automatically succeed.
name: The Machine in Yellow
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half your “Memories” (rounded down).
[cultist]: -X. X is the number of hidden cards in your hand.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. Double that token’s modifier.
[elder_thing]: -4. You may choose to cross out a tally mark next to your investigator’s “Memories” to automatically succeed.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -3. If you are at a [[Cave]] location, take 1 damage.
[cultist]: -3. If you are at a [[Carcosa]] location, take 1 horror.
[tablet]: -2. You must either (choose one): Reveal another token, or cross out 1 tally mark next to your “Memories.”
[elder_thing]: -3. If you are at a [[Carcosa]] location: Add 1 doom to the current agenda, or automatically fail this skill test.
name: Fragment of Carcosa
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -2. If fail while you are at a [[Cave]] location, take 1 damage.
[cultist]: -3. If you fail while you are at a [[Carcosa]] location, take 1 horror.
[tablet]: -1. You must either (choose one): Reveal another token, or cross out 1 tally mark next to your “Memories.”
[elder_thing]: -2. If you are at a [[Carcosa]] location: Add 1 doom to the current agenda, or automatically fail this skill test.

name: Bottle of Whispers
text:
Fast.
[reaction]When an investigator at your location reveals an [auto_fail] token, remove Bottle of Whispers from the game: Cancel that token and treat it as an [elder_sign] token instead.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of locations in play (rounded up).
[cultist]: -4. If you fail by 2 or more, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
[tablet]: Increase the difficulty of this skill test by 1. Reveal another token.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or take 1 horror for each point you fail by.
name: Starfall
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of revealed locations without clues (rounded up).
[cultist]: -3. If you fail by 2 or more, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
[tablet]: Increase the difficulty of this skill test by 1. Reveal another token.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or take 1 horror for each point you fail by.
